Generation IV.Diamond: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.
Generation IV.Pearl: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
Generation IV.Platinum: It binds its body with its tails to make itself look bigger. If it locks eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

Generation VI.X: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
Generation VI.Y: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its split tail.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Mirage Forests (west of Route 114 , north of Lilycove City , north of Route 124 ), Mirage Island (north of Route 125 )
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Mirage Forests (west of Route 114 , north of Lilycove City , north of Route 124 ), Mirage Island (north of Route 125 )
